apiList.Name: ActivateGateway
apiList.Desc: Activates the gateway you previously deployed on your host. In the activation process, you specify information such as the AWS Region that you want to use for storing snapshots or tapes, the time zone for scheduled snapshots the gateway snapshot schedule window, an activation key, and a name for your gateway. The activation process also associates your gateway with your account. For more information, see UpdateGatewayInformation.

RequestParameters.constraints:
For more information, see Getting activation key in the Storage Gateway User Guide.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 50.
RequestParameters.desc: Your gateway activation key. You can obtain the activation key by sending an HTTP GET request with redirects enabled to the gateway IP address (port 80). The redirect URL returned in the response provides you the activation key for your gateway in the query string parameter activationKey. It may also include other activation-related parameters, however, these are merely defaults -- the arguments you pass to the ActivateGateway API call determine the actual configuration of your gateway.
RequestParameters.name: ActivationKey

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 255.
Pattern: ^[ -\.0-\[\]-~]*[!-\.0-\[\]-~][ -\.0-\[\]-~]*$
RequestParameters.desc: The name you configured for your gateway.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayName

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: See Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas in the AWS General Reference.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 25.
RequestParameters.desc: A value that indicates the AWS Region where you want to store your data. The gateway AWS Region specified must be the same AWS Region as the AWS Region in your Host header in the request. For more information about available AWS Regions and endpoints for Storage Gateway, see Storage Gateway endpoints and quotas in the AWS General Reference.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayRegion

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 3. Maximum length of 10.
RequestParameters.desc: A value that indicates the time zone you want to set for the gateway. The time zone is of the format "GMT", "GMT-hr:mm", or "GMT+hr:mm". For example, GMT indicates Greenwich Mean Time without any offset. GMT-4:00 indicates the time is 4 hours behind GMT. GMT+2:00 indicates the time is 2 hours ahead of GMT. The time zone is used, for example, for scheduling snapshots and your gateway's maintenance schedule.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayTimezone

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: STORED | CACHED | VTL | FILE_S3 | FILE_FSX_SMB
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 20.
RequestParameters.desc: A value that defines the type of gateway to activate. The type specified is critical to all later functions of the gateway and cannot be changed after activation. The default value is CACHED.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayType

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: STK-L700 | AWS-Gateway-VTL | IBM-03584L32-0402
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 50.
RequestParameters.desc: The value that indicates the type of medium changer to use for tape gateway. This field is optional.
RequestParameters.name: MediumChangerType

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers that can be represented in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256 characters.
RequestParameters.desc: A list of up to 50 tags that you can assign to the gateway. Each tag is a key-value pair.
RequestParameters.name: Tags

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: IBM-ULT3580-TD5
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 50.
RequestParameters.desc: The value that indicates the type of tape drive to use for tape gateway. This field is optional.
RequestParameters.name: TapeDriveType

ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.
ResponseElements.name: GatewayARN

Errors.info: An exception occurred because an invalid gateway request was issued to the service. For more information, see the error and message fields.

For example, you can categorize resources by purpose, owner, environment, or team. Each tag consists of a key and a value, which you define. You can add tags to the following Storage Gateway resources:

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid characters for key and value are letters, spaces, and numbers representable in UTF-8 format, and the following special characters: + - = . _ : / @. The maximum length of a tag's key is 128 characters, and the maximum length for a tag's value is 256.

apiList.Name: AssignTapePool
apiList.Desc: Assigns a tape to a tape pool for archiving. The tape assigned to a pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the S3 storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid values: TRUE | FALSE
RequestParameters.desc: Set permissions to bypass governance retention. If the lock type of the archived tape is Governance, the tape's archived age is not older than RetentionLockInDays, and the user does not already have BypassGovernanceRetention, setting this to TRUE enables the user to bypass the retention lock. This parameter is set to true by default for calls from the console.
RequestParameters.name: BypassGovernanceRetention

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 100.
RequestParameters.desc: The ID of the pool that you want to add your tape to for archiving. The tape in this pool is archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.
RequestParameters.name: PoolId

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
Pattern: arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):storagegateway:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]+:tape\/[0-9A-Z]{5,16}$
RequestParameters.desc: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape that you want to add to the tape pool.
RequestParameters.name: TapeARN

ResponseElements.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
Pattern: arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):storagegateway:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]+:tape\/[0-9A-Z]{5,16}$
ResponseElements.desc: The unique Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the virtual tape that was added to the tape pool.
ResponseElements.name: TapeARN

Errors.info: An exception occurred because an invalid gateway request was issued to the service. For more information, see the error and message fields.

RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for the audit logs.

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 8. Maximum length of 512.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon FSx file system to associate with the FSx File Gateway.

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.
Pattern: ^[ -~]+$
RequestParameters.desc: The password of the user credential.

RequestParameters.desc: A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to the file system association. Each tag is a key-value pair.

Pattern: ^\w[\w\.\- ]*$
RequestParameters.desc: The user name of the user credential that has permission to access the root share D$ of the Amazon FSx file system. The user account must belong to the Amazon FSx delegated admin user group.

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.

apiList.Name: AttachVolume
apiList.Desc: Connects a volume to an iSCSI connection and then attaches the volume to the specified gateway. Detaching and attaching a volume enables you to recover your data from one gateway to a different gateway without creating a snapshot. It also makes it easier to move your volumes from an on-premises gateway to a gateway hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance.

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 300.
RequestParameters.desc: The unique device ID or other distinguishing data that identifies the local disk used to create the volume. This value is only required when you are attaching a stored volume.
RequestParameters.name: DiskId

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that you want to attach the volume to.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayARN

RequestParameters.desc: The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use DescribeGatewayInformation to get a list of the network interfaces available on a gateway.
RequestParameters.name: NetworkInterfaceId

RequestParameters.constraints:
If you don't specify a value, Storage Gateway uses the value that was previously used for this volume as the new target name.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 200.
Pattern: ^[-\.;a-z0-9]+$
RequestParameters.desc: The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example, specifying TargetName as myvolume results in the target ARN of arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume. The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
RequestParameters.name: TargetName

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume to attach to the specified gateway.
RequestParameters.name: VolumeARN

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 800.
ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target, which includes the iSCSI name for the initiator that was used to connect to the target.
ResponseElements.name: TargetARN

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume that was attached to the gateway.
ResponseElements.name: VolumeARN

RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false

The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.

apiList.Name: CreateNFSFileShare
apiList.Desc: Creates a Network File System (NFS) file share on an existing S3 File Gateway. In Storage Gateway, a file share is a file system mount point backed by Amazon S3 cloud storage. Storage Gateway exposes file shares using an NFS interface. This operation is only supported for S3 File Gateways.
apiList.RequestSyntax:
{
   "AuditDestinationARN": "string",
   "BucketRegion": "string",
   "CacheAttributes": { 
      "CacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds": number
   },
   "ClientList": [ "string" ],
   "ClientToken": "string",
   "DefaultStorageClass": "string",
   "FileShareName": "string",
   "GatewayARN": "string",
   "GuessMIMETypeEnabled": boolean,
   "KMSEncrypted": boolean,
   "KMSKey": "string",
   "LocationARN": "string",
   "NFSFileShareDefaults": { 
      "DirectoryMode": "string",
      "FileMode": "string",
      "GroupId": number,
      "OwnerId": number
   },
   "NotificationPolicy": "string",
   "ObjectACL": "string",
   "ReadOnly": boolean,
   "RequesterPays": boolean,
   "Role": "string",
   "Squash": "string",
   "Tags": [ 
      { 
         "Key": "string",
         "Value": "string"
      }
   ],
   "VPCEndpointDNSName": "string"
}

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Maximum length of 1024.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
RequestParameters.name: AuditDestinationARN

RequestParameters.constraints:
This parameter is required for NFS file shares that connect to Amazon S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point alias that points to a VPC access point.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 25.
RequestParameters.desc: Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the NFS file share stores files.
RequestParameters.name: BucketRegion

RequestParameters.desc: Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
RequestParameters.name: CacheAttributes

RequestParameters.desc: The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
RequestParameters.name: ClientList

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 5. Maximum length of 100.
RequestParameters.desc: A unique string value that you supply that is used by S3 File Gateway to ensure idempotent file share creation.
RequestParameters.name: ClientToken

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: S3_STANDARD | S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING | S3_STANDARD_IA | S3_ONEZONE_IA
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 5. Maximum length of 50.
RequestParameters.desc: The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway. The default value is S3_STANDARD. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: DefaultStorageClass

RequestParameters.constraints:
FileShareName must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in LocationARN, or if an access point or access point alias is used.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.
RequestParameters.desc: The name of the file share. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: FileShareName

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 File Gateway on which you want to create a file share.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayARN

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file extensions. Set this value to true to enable MIME type guessing, otherwise set to false. The default value is true.
RequestParameters.name: GuessMIMETypeEnabled

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: Set to true to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own AWS KMS key, or false to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: KMSEncrypted

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 7. Maximum length of 2048.
Pattern: (^arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):kms:([a-zA-Z0-9-]+):([0-9]+):(key|alias)/(\S+)$)|(^alias/(\S+)$)
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when KMSEncrypted is true. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: KMSKey

RequestParameters.constraints:
You can specify LocationARN as a bucket ARN, access point ARN or access point alias, as shown in the following examples.
Bucket ARN:
arn:aws:s3:::my-bucket/prefix/
Access point ARN:
arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name/prefix/

Structs.desc: Describes a bandwidth rate limit interval for a gateway. A bandwidth rate limit schedule consists of one or more bandwidth rate limit intervals. A bandwidth rate limit interval defines a period of time on one or more days of the week, during which bandwidth rate limits are specified for uploading, downloading, or both.

fields.constraints:
Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 7 items.
Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 6.
fields.desc: The days of the week component of the bandwidth rate limit interval, represented as ordinal numbers from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday and 6 represents Saturday.
fields.name: DaysOfWeek

fields.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 23.
fields.desc: The hour of the day to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
fields.name: EndHourOfDay

fields.constraints:
The bandwidth rate limit interval ends at the end of the minute. To end an interval at the end of an hour, use the value 59.
Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 59.
fields.desc: The minute of the hour to end the bandwidth rate limit interval.
fields.name: EndMinuteOfHour

fields.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 23.
fields.desc: The hour of the day to start the bandwidth rate limit interval.
fields.name: StartHourOfDay

fields.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 59.
fields.desc: The minute of the hour to start the bandwidth rate limit interval. The interval begins at the start of that minute. To begin an interval exactly at the start of the hour, use the value 0.
fields.name: StartMinuteOfHour

fields.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 102400.
fields.desc: The average download rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the response if the download rate limit is not set.
fields.name: AverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec

fields.constraints:
For Tape Gateway and Volume Gateway, the minimum value is 51200.
For S3 File Gateway and FSx File Gateway, the minimum value is 104857600.
Valid Range: Minimum value of 51200.
fields.desc: The average upload rate limit component of the bandwidth rate limit interval, in bits per second. This field does not appear in the response if the upload rate limit is not set.
fields.name: AverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec

fields.constraints:
SettlingTimeInSeconds has no effect on the timing of the object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
The following example sets NotificationPolicy on with SettlingTimeInSeconds set to 60.
{\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
The following example sets NotificationPolicy off.
{}

This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point alias that points to a VPC access point.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 25.
fields.desc: Specifies the Region of the S3 bucket where the SMB file share stores files.
fields.name: BucketRegion

fields.desc: Refresh cache information for the file share.
fields.name: CacheAttributes

fields.constraints: Valid Values: ClientSpecified | CaseSensitive
fields.desc: The case of an object name in an Amazon S3 bucket. For ClientSpecified, the client determines the case sensitivity. For CaseSensitive, the gateway determines the case sensitivity. The default value is ClientSpecified.
fields.name: CaseSensitivity

fields.constraints:
Valid Values: S3_STANDARD | S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING | S3_STANDARD_IA | S3_ONEZONE_IA
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 5. Maximum length of 50.
fields.desc: The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway. The default value is S3_STANDARD. Optional.
fields.name: DefaultStorageClass

fields.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
fields.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share.
fields.name: FileShareARN

fields.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 12. Maximum length of 30.
fields.desc: The ID of the file share.
fields.name: FileShareId

fields.constraints:
FileShareName must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in LocationARN, or if an access point or access point alias is used.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.
fields.desc: The name of the file share. Optional.
fields.name: FileShareName

fields.constraints:
Valid Values: CREATING | UPDATING | AVAILABLE | DELETING
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 3. Maximum length of 50.
fields.desc: The status of the file share.
fields.name: FileShareStatus

fields.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
fields.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.
fields.name: GatewayARN

fields.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
fields.desc: A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file extensions. Set this value to true to enable MIME type guessing, otherwise set to false. The default value is true.
fields.name: GuessMIMETypeEnabled

fields.constraints:
Array Members: Minimum number of 0 items. Maximum number of 100 items.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 64.
fields.desc: A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are not allowed to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats include: DOMAIN\User1, user1, @group1, and @DOMAIN\group1. Can only be set if Authentication is set to ActiveDirectory.
fields.name: InvalidUserList

fields.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
fields.desc: Set to true to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own AWS KMS key, or false to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
fields.name: KMSEncrypted

fields.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 7. Maximum length of 2048.
Pattern: (^arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):kms:([a-zA-Z0-9-]+):([0-9]+):(key|alias)/(\S+)$)|(^alias/(\S+)$)
fields.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when KMSEncrypted is true. Optional.
fields.name: KMSKey

fields.constraints:
You can specify LocationARN as a bucket ARN, access point ARN or access point alias, as shown in the following examples.
Bucket ARN:
arn:aws:s3:::my-bucket/prefix/
Access point ARN:
arn:aws:s3:region:account-id:accesspoint/access-point-name/prefix/
If you specify an access point, the bucket policy must be configured to delegate access control to the access point. For information, see Delegating access control to access points in the Amazon S3 User Guide.
Access point alias:
test-ap-ab123cdef4gehijklmn5opqrstuvuse1a-s3alias
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 16. Maximum length of 1400.
fields.desc: A custom ARN for the backend storage used for storing data for file shares. It includes a resource ARN with an optional prefix concatenation. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).
fields.name: LocationARN

fields.constraints:
SettlingTimeInSeconds has no effect on the timing of the object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
The following example sets NotificationPolicy on with SettlingTimeInSeconds set to 60.
{\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
The following example sets NotificationPolicy off.
{}
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 100.
Pattern: ^\{[\w\s:\{\}\[\]"]*}$
fields.desc: The notification policy of the file share. SettlingTimeInSeconds controls the number of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before generating an ObjectUploaded notification. Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for the same file in a small time period.
fields.name: NotificationPolicy

fields.constraints: Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control | aws-exec-read
fields.desc: A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that an S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is private.
fields.name: ObjectACL

fields.constraints:
Enabling opportunistic locking on case-sensitive shares is not recommended for workloads that involve access to files with the same name in different case.
Valid Values: true | false
fields.desc: Specifies whether opportunistic locking is enabled for the SMB file share.
fields.name: OplocksEnabled

fields.desc: The file share path used by the SMB client to identify the mount point.
fields.name: Path

fields.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
fields.desc: A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to true to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to false.
fields.name: ReadOnly

fields.constraints:
RequesterPays is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
Valid Values: true | false
fields.desc: A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to true, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
fields.name: RequesterPays

fields.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 20. Maximum length of 2048.
Pattern: ^arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):iam::([0-9]+):role/(\S+)$
fields.desc: The ARN of the IAM role that an S3 File Gateway assumes when it accesses the underlying storage.
fields.name: Role

fields.constraints: For more information, see Using Microsoft Windows ACLs to control access to an SMB file share in the Storage Gateway User Guide.
fields.desc: If this value is set to true, it indicates that access control list (ACL) is enabled on the SMB file share. If it is set to false, it indicates that file and directory permissions are mapped to the POSIX permission.
fields.name: SMBACLEnabled

fields.desc: A list of up to 50 tags assigned to the SMB file share, sorted alphabetically by key name. Each tag is a key-value pair. For a gateway with more than 10 tags assigned, you can view all tags using the ListTagsForResource API operation.
fields.name: Tags

fields.constraints:
Array Members: Minimum number of 0 items. Maximum number of 100 items.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 64.
fields.desc: A list of users or groups in the Active Directory that are allowed to access the file share. A group must be prefixed with the @ character. Acceptable formats include: DOMAIN\User1, user1, @group1, and @DOMAIN\group1. Can only be set if Authentication is set to ActiveDirectory.
fields.name: ValidUserList

fields.constraints:
This parameter is required for SMB file shares that connect to Amazon S3 through a VPC endpoint, a VPC access point, or an access point alias that points to a VPC access point.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.
Pattern: ^(([a-zA-Z0-9\-]*[a-zA-Z0-9])\.)*([A-Za-z0-9\-]*[A-Za-z0-9])$
fields.desc: Specifies the DNS name for the VPC endpoint that the SMB file share uses to connect to Amazon S3.
fields.name: VPCEndpointDNSName

apiList.Name: DescribeSMBSettings
apiList.Desc: Gets a description of a Server Message Block (SMB) file share settings from a file gateway. This operation is only supported for file gateways.

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayARN

ResponseElements.constraints:
ACCESS_DENIED: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed due to an authentication error.
DETACHED: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a domain.
JOINED: Indicates that the gateway has successfully joined a domain.
JOINING: Indicates that a JoinDomain operation is in progress.
NETWORK_ERROR: Indicates that JoinDomain operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.
TIMEOUT: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted time.
UNKNOWN_ERROR: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed due to another type of error.
Valid Values: ACCESS_DENIED | DETACHED | JOINED | JOINING | NETWORK_ERROR | TIMEOUT | UNKNOWN_ERROR
ResponseElements.desc: Indicates the status of a gateway that is a member of the Active Directory domain.
ResponseElements.name: ActiveDirectoryStatus

ResponseElements.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.
Pattern: ^([a-zA-Z0-9]+[\\.-])+([a-zA-Z0-9])+$
ResponseElements.desc: The name of the domain that the gateway is joined to.
ResponseElements.name: DomainName

ResponseElements.desc: The shares on this gateway appear when listing shares. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.
ResponseElements.name: FileSharesVisible

ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.
ResponseElements.name: GatewayARN

ResponseElements.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
ResponseElements.desc: This value is true if a password for the guest user smbguest is set, otherwise false. Only supported for S3 File Gateways.
ResponseElements.name: SMBGuestPasswordSet

ResponseElements.desc: A list of Active Directory users and groups that have special permissions for SMB file shares on the gateway.
ResponseElements.name: SMBLocalGroups

ResponseElements.constraints:
ClientSpecified: If you choose this option, requests are established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in your environment. Supported only for S3 File Gateway.
MandatorySigning: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing turned on. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, or later.
MandatoryEncryption: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption turned on. Both 256-bit and 128-bit algorithms are allowed. This option is recommended for environments that handle sensitive data. It works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, or later.
MandatoryEncryptionNoAes128: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that use 256-bit AES encryption algorithms. 128-bit algorithms are not allowed. This option is recommended for environments that handle sensitive data. It works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, or later.
Valid Values: ClientSpecified | MandatorySigning | MandatoryEncryption | MandatoryEncryptionNoAes128
ResponseElements.desc: The type of security strategy that was specified for file gateway.
ResponseElements.name: SMBSecurityStrategy

Structs.desc: A list of Active Directory users and groups that have special permissions for SMB file shares on the gateway.

apiList.Name: DescribeTapeArchives
apiList.Desc: Returns a description of specified virtual tapes in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.

RequestParameters.desc: Specifies that the number of virtual tapes described be limited to the specified number.

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1000.
RequestParameters.desc: An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin describing virtual tapes.
RequestParameters.name: Marker

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
Pattern: arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):storagegateway:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]+:tape\/[0-9A-Z]{5,16}$
RequestParameters.desc: Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that represent the virtual tapes you want to describe.

{
   "Marker": "string",
   "TapeArchives": [ 
      { 
         "CompletionTime": number,
         "KMSKey": "string",
         "PoolEntryDate": number,
         "PoolId": "string",
         "RetentionStartDate": number,
         "RetrievedTo": "string",
         "TapeARN": "string",
         "TapeBarcode": "string",
         "TapeCreatedDate": number,

}

Use this marker in your next request to fetch the next set of virtual tapes in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). If there are no more virtual tapes to describe, this field does not appear in the response.

ResponseElements.desc: An array of virtual tape objects in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). The description includes of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tapes. The information returned includes the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the tapes, size of the tapes, status of the tapes, progress of the description, and tape barcode.

apiList.Name: DetachVolume
apiList.Desc: Disconnects a volume from an iSCSI connection and then detaches the volume from the specified gateway. Detaching and attaching a volume enables you to recover your data from one gateway to a different gateway without creating a snapshot. It also makes it easier to move your volumes from an on-premises gateway to a gateway hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance. This operation is only supported in the volume gateway type.

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false

RequestParameters.desc: Sets the password of the user who has permission to add the gateway to the Active Directory domain.
RequestParameters.name: Password

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 3600.
RequestParameters.desc: Specifies the time in seconds, in which the JoinDomain operation must complete. The default is 20 seconds.
RequestParameters.name: TimeoutInSeconds

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.
Pattern: ^\w[\w\.\- ]*$
RequestParameters.desc: Sets the user name of user who has permission to add the gateway to the Active Directory domain. The domain user account should be enabled to join computers to the domain. For example, you can use the domain administrator account or an account with delegated permissions to join computers to the domain.
RequestParameters.name: UserName

ResponseElements.constraints:
ACCESS_DENIED: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed due to an authentication error.
DETACHED: Indicates that gateway is not joined to a domain.
JOINED: Indicates that the gateway has successfully joined a domain.
JOINING: Indicates that a JoinDomain operation is in progress.
NETWORK_ERROR: Indicates that JoinDomain operation failed due to a network or connectivity error.
TIMEOUT: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed because the operation didn't complete within the allotted time.
UNKNOWN_ERROR: Indicates that the JoinDomain operation failed due to another type of error.
Valid Values: ACCESS_DENIED | DETACHED | JOINED | JOINING | NETWORK_ERROR | TIMEOUT | UNKNOWN_ERROR
ResponseElements.desc: Indicates the status of the gateway as a member of the Active Directory domain.

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
ResponseElements.desc: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway that joined the domain.

fields.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.

fields.constraints:

Pattern: ^[ -\.0-\[\]-~]*[!-\.0-\[\]-~][ -\.0-\[\]-~]*$
fields.desc: The name of the custom tape pool. PoolName can use all ASCII characters, except '/' and '\'.
fields.name: PoolName

fields.constraints: Valid Values: ACTIVE | DELETED
fields.desc: Status of the custom tape pool. Pool can be ACTIVE or DELETED.
fields.name: PoolStatus

fields.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 36500.
fields.desc: Tape retention lock time is set in days. Tape retention lock can be enabled for up to 100 years (36,500 days).
fields.name: RetentionLockTimeInDays

fields.constraints: Valid Values: COMPLIANCE | GOVERNANCE | NONE
fields.desc: Tape retention lock type, which can be configured in two modes. When configured in governance mode, AWS accounts with specific IAM permissions are authorized to remove the tape retention lock from archived virtual tapes. When configured in compliance mode, the tape retention lock cannot be removed by any user, including the root AWS account.
fields.name: RetentionLockType

fields.constraints: Valid Values: DEEP_ARCHIVE | GLACIER
fields.desc: The storage class that is associated with the custom pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.

apiList.Name: RefreshCache
apiList.Desc: Refreshes the cached inventory of objects for the specified file share. This operation finds objects in the Amazon S3 bucket that were added, removed, or replaced since the gateway last listed the bucket's contents and cached the results. This operation does not import files into the S3 File Gateway cache storage. It only updates the cached inventory to reflect changes in the inventory of the objects in the S3 bucket. This operation is only supported in the S3 File Gateway types.

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share you want to refresh.
RequestParameters.name: FileShareARN

RequestParameters.constraints:
Do not include / when specifying folder names. For example, you would specify samplefolder rather than samplefolder/.
Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 50 items.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.
RequestParameters.desc: A comma-separated list of the paths of folders to refresh in the cache. The default is ["/"]. The default refreshes objects and folders at the root of the Amazon S3 bucket. If Recursive is set to true, the entire S3 bucket that the file share has access to is refreshed.
RequestParameters.name: FolderList

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: A value that specifies whether to recursively refresh folders in the cache. The refresh includes folders that were in the cache the last time the gateway listed the folder's contents. If this value set to true, each folder that is listed in FolderList is recursively updated. Otherwise, subfolders listed in FolderList are not refreshed. Only objects that are in folders listed directly under FolderList are found and used for the update. The default is true.
RequestParameters.name: Recursive

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share.
ResponseElements.name: FileShareARN

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 2048.
ResponseElements.desc: The randomly generated ID of the notification that was sent. This ID is in UUID format.
ResponseElements.name: NotificationId

apiList.Name: ResetCache
apiList.Desc: Resets all cache disks that have encountered an error and makes the disks available for reconfiguration as cache storage. If your cache disk encounters an error, the gateway prevents read and write operations on virtual tapes in the gateway. For example, an error can occur when a disk is corrupted or removed from the gateway. When a cache is reset, the gateway loses its cache storage. At this point, you can reconfigure the disks as cache disks. This operation is only supported in the cached volume and tape types.

To update bandwidth rate limits for S3 file gateways, use UpdateBandwidthRateLimitSchedule.

apiList.Name: UpdateBandwidthRateLimitSchedule
apiList.Desc: Updates the bandwidth rate limit schedule for a specified gateway. By default, gateways do not have bandwidth rate limit schedules, which means no bandwidth rate limiting is in effect. Use this to initiate or update a gateway's bandwidth rate limit schedule. This operation is supported for volume, tape, and S3 file gateways. S3 file gateways support bandwidth rate limits for upload only. FSx file gateways do not support bandwidth rate limits.

RequestParameters.constraints: Array Members: Minimum number of 0 items. Maximum number of 20 items.
RequestParameters.desc: An array containing bandwidth rate limit schedule intervals for a gateway. When no bandwidth rate limit intervals have been scheduled, the array is empty.

apiList.Name: UpdateChapCredentials
apiList.Desc: Updates the Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) credentials for a specified iSCSI target. By default, a gateway does not have CHAP enabled; however, for added security, you might use it. This operation is supported in the volume and tape gateway types.

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.
Pattern: [0-9a-z:.-]+
RequestParameters.desc: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.

RequestParameters.constraints:
The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 100.
RequestParameters.desc: The secret key that the initiator (for example, the Windows client) must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.

RequestParameters.constraints:
Byte constraints: Minimum bytes of 12. Maximum bytes of 16.
The secret key must be between 12 and 16 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 100.
RequestParameters.desc: The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g. Windows client).

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 800.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes operation to return the TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.

ResponseElements.constraints:

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 800.
ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target. This is the same target specified in the request.

apiList.Name: UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
apiList.Desc: Updates a gateway's maintenance window schedule, with settings for monthly or weekly cadence, specific day and time to begin maintenance, and which types of updates to apply. Time configuration uses the gateway's time zone. You can pass values for a complete maintenance schedule, or update policy, or both. Previous values will persist for whichever setting you choose not to modify. If an incomplete or invalid maintenance schedule is passed, the entire request will be rejected with an error and no changes will occur.

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 28.
RequestParameters.desc: The day of the month component of the maintenance start time represented as an ordinal number from 1 to 28, where 1 represents the first day of the month. It is not possible to set the maintenance schedule to start on days 29 through 31.
RequestParameters.name: DayOfMonth

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 6.
RequestParameters.desc: The day of the week component of the maintenance start time week represented as an ordinal number from 0 to 6, where 0 represents Sunday and 6 represents Saturday.
RequestParameters.name: DayOfWeek

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.
RequestParameters.name: GatewayARN

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 23.
RequestParameters.desc: The hour component of the maintenance start time represented as hh, where hh is the hour (00 to 23). The hour of the day is in the time zone of the gateway.
RequestParameters.name: HourOfDay

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Range: Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 59.
RequestParameters.desc: The minute component of the maintenance start time represented as mm, where mm is the minute (00 to 59). The minute of the hour is in the time zone of the gateway.
RequestParameters.name: MinuteOfHour

RequestParameters.constraints:
Includes AutomaticUpdatePolicy field with the following inputs:
ALL_VERSIONS - Enables regular gateway maintenance updates.
EMERGENCY_VERSIONS_ONLY - Disables regular gateway maintenance updates.
RequestParameters.desc: A set of variables indicating the software update preferences for the gateway.
RequestParameters.name: SoftwareUpdatePreferences

ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and AWS Region.

apiList.Name: UpdateNFSFileShare
apiList.Desc: Updates a Network File System (NFS) file share. This operation is only supported in S3 File Gateways.
apiList.RequestSyntax:
{
   "AuditDestinationARN": "string",
   "CacheAttributes": { 
      "CacheStaleTimeoutInSeconds": number
   },
   "ClientList": [ "string" ],
   "DefaultStorageClass": "string",
   "FileShareARN": "string",
   "FileShareName": "string",
   "GuessMIMETypeEnabled": boolean,
   "KMSEncrypted": boolean,
   "KMSKey": "string",
   "NFSFileShareDefaults": { 
      "DirectoryMode": "string",
      "FileMode": "string",
      "GroupId": number,
      "OwnerId": number
   },
   "NotificationPolicy": "string",
   "ObjectACL": "string",
   "ReadOnly": boolean,
   "RequesterPays": boolean,
   "Squash": "string"
}

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Maximum length of 1024.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage used for audit logs.
RequestParameters.name: AuditDestinationARN

RequestParameters.desc: Specifies refresh cache information for the file share.
RequestParameters.name: CacheAttributes

RequestParameters.desc: The list of clients that are allowed to access the S3 File Gateway. The list must contain either valid IP addresses or valid CIDR blocks.
RequestParameters.name: ClientList

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid Values: S3_STANDARD | S3_INTELLIGENT_TIERING | S3_STANDARD_IA | S3_ONEZONE_IA
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 5. Maximum length of 50.
RequestParameters.desc: The default storage class for objects put into an Amazon S3 bucket by the S3 File Gateway. The default value is S3_STANDARD. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: DefaultStorageClass

RequestParameters.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file share to be updated.
RequestParameters.name: FileShareARN

RequestParameters.constraints:
FileShareName must be set if an S3 prefix name is set in LocationARN, or if an access point or access point alias is used.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.
RequestParameters.desc: The name of the file share. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: FileShareName

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: A value that enables guessing of the MIME type for uploaded objects based on file extensions. Set this value to true to enable MIME type guessing, otherwise set to false. The default value is true.
RequestParameters.name: GuessMIMETypeEnabled

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: Set to true to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own AWS KMS key, or false to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: KMSEncrypted

RequestParameters.constraints:
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 7. Maximum length of 2048.
Pattern: (^arn:(aws(|-cn|-us-gov|-iso[A-Za-z0-9_-]*)):kms:([a-zA-Z0-9-]+):([0-9]+):(key|alias)/(\S+)$)|(^alias/(\S+)$)
RequestParameters.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value can only be set when KMSEncrypted is true. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: KMSKey

RequestParameters.desc: The default values for the file share. Optional.
RequestParameters.name: NFSFileShareDefaults

RequestParameters.constraints:
SettlingTimeInSeconds has no effect on the timing of the object uploading to Amazon S3, only the timing of the notification.
The following example sets NotificationPolicy on with SettlingTimeInSeconds set to 60.
{\"Upload\": {\"SettlingTimeInSeconds\": 60}}
The following example sets NotificationPolicy off.
{}
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 2. Maximum length of 100.
Pattern: ^\{[\w\s:\{\}\[\]"]*}$
RequestParameters.desc: The notification policy of the file share. SettlingTimeInSeconds controls the number of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before generating an ObjectUploaded notification. Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for the same file in a small time period.
RequestParameters.name: NotificationPolicy

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control | aws-exec-read
RequestParameters.desc: A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is private.
RequestParameters.name: ObjectACL

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: A value that sets the write status of a file share. Set this value to true to set the write status to read-only, otherwise set to false.
RequestParameters.name: ReadOnly

RequestParameters.constraints:
RequesterPays is a configuration for the S3 bucket that backs the file share, so make sure that the configuration on the file share is the same as the S3 bucket configuration.
Valid Values: true | false
RequestParameters.desc: A value that sets who pays the cost of the request and the cost associated with data download from the S3 bucket. If this value is set to true, the requester pays the costs; otherwise, the S3 bucket owner pays. However, the S3 bucket owner always pays the cost of storing data.
RequestParameters.name: RequesterPays

RequestParameters.constraints:
Valid values are the following:
RootSquash: Only root is mapped to anonymous user.
NoSquash: No one is mapped to anonymous user.
AllSquash: Everyone is mapped to anonymous user.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 5. Maximum length of 15.
RequestParameters.desc: The user mapped to anonymous user.
RequestParameters.name: Squash

ResponseElements.constraints: Length Constraints: Minimum length of 50. Maximum length of 500.
ResponseElements.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the updated file share.
ResponseElements.name: FileShareARN

Errors.info: An internal server error has occurred during the request. For more information, see the error and message fields.

Errors.name: InvalidGatewayRequestException
Errors.info: An exception occurred because an invalid gateway request was issued to the service. For more information, see the error and message fields.

SettlingTimeInSeconds controls the number of seconds to wait after the last point in time a client wrote to a file before generating an ObjectUploaded notification. Because clients can make many small writes to files, it's best to set this parameter for as long as possible to avoid generating multiple notifications for the same file in a small time period.

RequestParameters.constraints: Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control | aws-exec-read
RequestParameters.desc: A value that sets the access control list (ACL) permission for objects in the S3 bucket that a S3 File Gateway puts objects into. The default value is private.

RequestParameters.constraints:
ClientSpecified: If you choose this option, requests are established based on what is negotiated by the client. This option is recommended when you want to maximize compatibility across different clients in your environment. Supported only for S3 File Gateway.
MandatorySigning: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv2 or SMBv3 clients that have signing enabled. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008 or newer.
MandatoryEncryption: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that have encryption enabled. This option is recommended for environments that handle sensitive data. This option works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 or newer.
MandatoryEncryptionNoAes128: If you choose this option, File Gateway only allows connections from SMBv3 clients that use 256-bit AES encryption algorithms. 128-bit algorithms are not allowed. This option is recommended for environments that handle sensitive data. It works with SMB clients on Microsoft Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, or later.
Valid Values: ClientSpecified | MandatorySigning | MandatoryEncryption | MandatoryEncryptionNoAes128
